year.sentence:
Teams that rested their starters in Week 17 have performed accordingly in their first playoff game since 2002:
2008: Titans* - Loss SU, Loss ATS 2008: Colts - Loss SU, Loss ATS 2007: Colts* - Loss SU, Loss ATS 2007: Jaguars - Win SU, Loss ATS 2007: Steelers - Loss SU, Win ATS 2007: Buccaneers - Loss SU, Loss ATS 2006: Eagles - Win SU, Loss ATS 2006: Saints* - Win SU, Loss ATS 2005: Colts* - Loss SU, Loss ATS 2004: Colts - Win SU, Win ATS 2004: Steelers* - Win SU, Loss ATS 2004: Chargers - Loss SU, Loss ATS 2004: Eagles* - Win SU, Win ATS 2002: 49ers - Win SU, Loss ATS
Teams that rested their starters in Week 17 are 7-7 straight up and 3-11 against the spread in their opening postseason contest.

1.comment:
Alge Crumpler fumbled the ball when he saw a hamburger on the ground and reached out for it. With Tennessee's loss, we can update the chart I posted on my page. Teams that rested their starters in Week 17 have performed accordingly in their first playoff game since 2002:
2008: Titans* - Loss SU, Loss ATS 2008: Colts - Loss SU, Loss ATS 2007: Colts* - Loss SU, Loss ATS 2007: Jaguars - Win SU, Loss ATS 2007: Steelers - Loss SU, Win ATS 2007: Buccaneers - Loss SU, Loss ATS 2006: Eagles - Win SU, Loss ATS 2006: Saints* - Win SU, Loss ATS 2005: Colts* - Loss SU, Loss ATS 2004: Colts - Win SU, Win ATS 2004: Steelers* - Win SU, Loss ATS 2004: Chargers - Loss SU, Loss ATS 2004: Eagles* - Win SU, Win ATS 2002: 49ers - Win SU, Loss ATS
Teams that rested their starters in Week 17 are 7-7 straight up and 3-11 against the spread in their opening postseason contest. But enough about the Titans and my degenerate betting - let's talk about the team that actually won this contest.
